page.title: 15JACKSONS FARM
page.content: Jacksons Farm was built in 1888 and there are still bars in some of the windows instead of glass.It is 85 acres and on this sheep are kept and grass grown.In the winter the owners buy sheep-cake which is made from barley, wheat and beans.The modern machinery has made farming much quicker and easier.The EEC have affected farming because farmers can only grow a certain amount of food but they do get a fair price for it.The landscape is flat, with a few hills on one side, but quite woody on the other.There are wild flowers, trees, and open fields.In 1888 there were a lot more trees and less open fields.Opposite Jacksons Farm are kennels in which racing dogs are kept.Nearby is a cravan site.The land has not changed that much.
